questions_unanswered: What about async?|Does this work with streaming?
trainer_notes: Room engaged until Section 6. Bug 1 took longest - many didn't understand why full history was needed.
session_highlights: The inventory use case in the hook landed really well - three people immediately said it matched their exact problem.

questions_unanswered: Can Claude call tools in parallel by default?|What's the token cost of tool schemas?
trainer_notes: Setup issues ate 7 minutes. Bug 2 was fastest fix - demo landed well. Section 6 energy held better in person than I expected.
session_highlights: Asking the room to explain the two-round-trip pattern in their own words before Exercise 1 - several got it exactly right and it visibly boosted confidence.

questions_unanswered: How do we handle large query results?|What if the tool needs auth tokens?
trainer_notes: Data team struggled with JSON schema syntax more than expected. Bug 3 confusing because it didn't always fail.
session_highlights: The mock weather function being visible in the same file made participants much more comfortable - they could see the whole system.

questions_unanswered: Is there a way to force tool use?|How do we prevent tool loops in production?
trainer_notes: Largest group so far. Buddy system worked extremely well at this size. Bug 1 still the hardest conceptually.
session_highlights: Drawing the two-round-trip diagram on a physical whiteboard instead of showing a slide - people photographed it and referred back to it.

questions_unanswered: What happens if max_tokens cuts off mid-tool-use?|Can we use tools with Claude.ai directly?
trainer_notes: Setup issues significant - 4 participants couldn't get API keys working during session. Data teams less familiar with API concepts generally.
session_highlights: The 'close laptops halfway' instruction after exercises - it genuinely refocused attention and felt natural.

questions_unanswered: How does tool use interact with system prompts?|What's the best way to test tool definitions?
trainer_notes: Version 1.1 felt tighter in Section 6. The pitfall table format much easier to move through than prose. Bug 2 still shows up but participants recover faster.
session_highlights: The checkpoint questions at minute 33 - asking people to think silently rather than answer out loud removed pressure and people seemed more engaged afterward.

questions_unanswered: Can tools access external URLs directly?|How do we version tool schemas?
trainer_notes: Second time running this. Much more comfortable. Demo Part 2 still the most technically dense section - may need another example.
session_highlights: The stretch prompt about Tesla and jacket - at least half the room tried it and the conversation about tool description quality was the best of the session.

questions_unanswered: How do we handle tool timeouts?|What's the pattern for tools that need multiple steps?
trainer_notes: DevOps team very comfortable with APIs but less familiar with LLM concepts generally. Hook needed more time - the inventory example felt distant from their world.
session_highlights: Framing tool use as 'your code stays in control, Claude just requests' - a DevOps participant said that reframe made the security model click immediately.
